snippet: The report, based on a study conducted after Uber and Mayor Bill de Blasio clashed over his plan to cap the number of for-hire vehicles on New York City’s streets, recommended against such a limit.
abstract: Report disproves Mayor Bill de Blasio's contention that Uber vehicles and other ride-hailing services are worsening traffic in Manhattan and recommends against de Blasio's proposed cap on Uber vehicles; conclusions, result of $2 million study, prompts truce between mayor and company.
lead_paragraph: The report, based on a study conducted after Uber and Mayor Bill de Blasio clashed over his plan to cap the number of for-hire vehicles on New York City’s streets, recommended against such a limit.

headline.main: Uber Not to Blame for Rise in Manhattan Traffic Congestion, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Uber Is Not to Blame for Rise in Manhattan Traffic Congestion, Report Says
